definitions.definition: The act or quality of endorsing
definitions.example: Companies sometimes pay millions for product endorsement by celebrities.

definitions.definition: An amendment or annotation to an insurance contract or other official document (such as a driving licence).
definitions.example: Mr. Jones paid extra for the flood damage endorsement on his house insurance.

definitions.definition: An instructor's signed acknowledgement of time practising specific flying skills.
definitions.example: Once she obtained the endorsement of her night flying hours, Joanna was approved to take the pilot's examination.

definitions.definition: (certification) Permission to carry out a specific skill or application in a field in which the practitioner already has a general licence.
definitions.example: To transport gasoline, truckers must have a valid licence and the hazardous materials endorsement.

definitions.definition: Sponsorship, in means of money, by a company, business or enterprise.
definitions.example: After the Olympics, he was hoping to get an endorsement deal.

definitions.definition: Support from an important, renowned figure of a media (celebrity, politics, sports, etc.), to get back up.
definitions.example: I'm not sure whether an endorsement from Donald Trump will help or hurt.
